alert.note: Alert for Cibola (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 26 at 1:58PM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central New Mexico, including the following county, Cibola. * WHEN...Until 500 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall from slow-moving thunderstorms will lead to excessive runoff and minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 158 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Seboyeta Creek, the Rio Paguate, Cebolletita, Mesita, Seboyeta, Bibo and Paguate. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 near Mile Marker 116.
info.instruction: Arroyos, streams, and normally dry rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes. Water in arroyos can travel many miles and take hours to reach your location from upstream rain areas.
